evidence.text: On February 12, 2025, the Court issued a temporary restraining order.
through the expiration of plaintiff’s five-year term as Special  Counsel

extracted.value: five-year term as Special Counsel: Injunction (Order (001))

evidence.text: the Court scheduled the preliminary injunction hearing for a date 14 days later: February 26.
the Court extended the temporary restraining order for an additional three days, through Saturday, March 1.

As of the date of this order, March 1, 2025, through the expiration of plaintiff’s five-year term as Special  Counsel, defendants Bessent, Gor, Gorman, Kammann, and Vought must recognize plaintiff’s title and position as Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel;

extracted.value: Recognize plaintiff’s title and position as Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel

evidence.text: …they must not obstruct or interfere with his performance of his duties;

extracted.value: Not obstruct or interfere with plaintiff’s performance of his duties

evidence.text: …they must not deny him the authority, benefits, or resources of his office;

extracted.value: Not deny him the authority, benefits, or resources of his office

evidence.text: …they must not recognize any Acting Special Counsel in his place;

extracted.value: Not recognize any Acting Special Counsel in his place

evidence.text: …they must not treat him in any way as if he has been removed, or recognize any other person as Special Counsel or as the head of the Office of Special Counsel, unless and until he is removed from office in accordance with 5 U.S.C. §1211(b).

extracted.value: Not treat him as if removed or recognize any other person as Special Counsel or head of the Office of Special Counsel unless removed

evidence.text: the temporary restraining order ... remain in force until the Court ruled on plaintiff’s request for preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: Maintain status quo until preliminary injunction is ruled

evidence.text: directed the parties to inform the Court of their positions as to whether the Court should advance the consideration of the merits and consolidate it with the preliminary injunction hearing under Rule of Civil Procedure 65(a)(2) by February 14, 2025.

extracted.value: Inform the Court of positions by February 14, 2025
